Sentencas: Strontium cerate (SrCeO3) exhibits proton conductivity in humidified atmosphere at elevated temperature.
Titulo: Synthesis, stability and conductivity of SrCe0.8-xZrxY0.2O3-δ as electrolyte for proton conducting SOFC

Sentencas: However this material is unstable in CO2 and H2O atmosphere.
Titulo: Synthesis, stability and conductivity of SrCe0.8-xZrxY0.2O3-δ as electrolyte for proton conducting SOFC

Sentencas: Thought its proton conductivity is lower than barium cerate (BaCeO3) there is scope to improve its stability, sinterability and ionic conductivity by substituting suitable cations at B-site.
Titulo: Synthesis, stability and conductivity of SrCe0.8-xZrxY0.2O3-δ as electrolyte for proton conducting SOFC

Sentencas: SrCe0.8-xZrxY0.2O3-delta (SCZY, with x = 0.0, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6 and 0.8) powders were synthesized by sol gel route.
Titulo: Synthesis, stability and conductivity of SrCe0.8-xZrxY0.2O3-δ as electrolyte for proton conducting SOFC

Sentencas: Lattice parameters were generated from powder XRD data and it was found that with increase in Zr content the cell volume reduces.
Titulo: Synthesis, stability and conductivity of SrCe0.8-xZrxY0.2O3-δ as electrolyte for proton conducting SOFC

Sentencas: Chemical stability of sintered SCZY samples was evaluated in 100% CO2 using TG-DTA up to 1173 K and also in boiling water.
Titulo: Synthesis, stability and conductivity of SrCe0.8-xZrxY0.2O3-δ as electrolyte for proton conducting SOFC

Sentencas: Zirconium doped samples exhibit enhanced chemical stability in presence of carbon dioxide and boiling water, with x >= 0.4 compositions having no effect of both the reactive gases.
Titulo: Synthesis, stability and conductivity of SrCe0.8-xZrxY0.2O3-δ as electrolyte for proton conducting SOFC

Sentencas: Proton conductivity of SCZY samples were measured in moist N-2 atmosphere.
Titulo: Synthesis, stability and conductivity of SrCe0.8-xZrxY0.2O3-δ as electrolyte for proton conducting SOFC

Sentencas: Activation energy for proton conduction was also evaluated.
Titulo: Synthesis, stability and conductivity of SrCe0.8-xZrxY0.2O3-δ as electrolyte for proton conducting SOFC
